title: David Di Pilla keeps Home Co board close
text:
David Di Pilla has long ties to most of his board. Louise Kennerley

How's this for a cosy board. At Home Co, even the independent directors appointed to keep a powerful executive chairman in check have long, pre-existing relationships with that same chairman.

The soon-to-be-listed commercial property company is headed by ex-UBS Australia managing director David Di Pilla, whose position as both chairman and CEO is fairly safe given he also set up aged-care operator Aurrum, one of the foundation shareholders that will hold 59 per cent of the company post-listing.

Sitting with him on the board is Zac Friend, of foundation shareholder and Home Co tenant Spotlight, and Greg Hayes, who used to head Tenix, a company founded by Di Pilla's wife's family. Hayes is also involved with Di Pilla in Aurrum.

As the prospectus points out, investing in a company that tightly controlled poses some risks. But they are ameliorated, would-be investors were assured, by the addition of three non-executive directors to represent the new shareholders, led by deputy chairman Chris Saxon.

Mind you, they're also independent directors Di Pilla already knows pretty well.
